data.event: Mail destined for Concord is now addressed to Knoxville or Farragut.

event.title: 1853, construction of the East Tennessee and Georgia Railroad along the north bank of the Tennessee River caused

data.event: In 1853, construction of the East Tennessee and Georgia Railroad along the north bank of the Tennessee River caused a population and development shift to the area that became Concord.
Concord was founded and platted in 1854 on land owned by James M. Rodgers.
He began to sell lots in 1855, but later moved to California.
